title.value: Strong Consistency and Rate of Convergence of Switched Least Squares System Identification for Autonomous Markov Jump Linear Systems
title.justification: It's the title of the paper.
title.quote: Strong Consistency and Rate of Convergence of Switched Least Squares System Identification for Autonomous Markov Jump Linear Systems

extractions.description: This paper investigates system identification for autonomous Markov jump linear systems (MJS) with complete state observations. It introduces the switched least squares method, proves its strong consistency, and provides data-dependent and data-independent rates of convergence. The results indicate that the proposed method has convergence rates similar to those of non-switched linear systems.

type.justification: The paper focuses on the theoretical development and analysis of the switched least squares method applied to Markov jump linear systems, providing proofs of consistency and convergence rates.
type.quote: We propose switched least squares method for identification of MJS, show that this method is strongly consistent, and derive data-dependent and data-independent rates of convergence.

name.justification: The paper's primary focus is on system identification methods within the domain of autonomous Markov jump linear systems, a subject closely related to control systems and signal processing, which are subfields of Computer Vision.
name.quote: We investigate the problem of system identification for autonomous Markov jump linear systems (MJS) with complete state observations.

name.justification: The paper deals with system identification methods and stability analysis which are crucial aspects of signal processing.
name.quote: There is a rich literature on the stability analysis...and optimal control...of MJS.

name.justification: The research discusses methods for system identification, a key component in control systems, particularly for Markov jump linear systems.
name.quote: The problem of identifying the system model from data is a key component for control synthesis for both offline control methods and online control methods including adaptive control and reinforcement learning.

name.justification: This model is explicitly introduced and analyzed in the paper for system identification of Markov jump linear systems.
name.quote: We propose switched least squares method for identification of MJS.

is_contributed.justification: The switched least squares method is the primary contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose switched least squares method for identification of MJS.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes illustrative numerical examples indicating that the method was executed.
is_executed.quote: We present numerical examples to illustrate the performance of the proposed method.

is_compared.justification: The method's convergence rate is compared with the rate of convergence of non-switched linear systems.
is_compared.quote: the switched least squares method for MJS has the same rate of convergence as least squares method for autonomous linear systems.

referenced_paper_title.value: Consistency and rate of convergence of switched least squares system identification for autonomous switched linear systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: This appears to be the referenced prior work related to the model the paper builds upon or compares with.
referenced_paper_title.quote: An earlier version of this paper is presented in 61st Conference on Decision and Control (CDC), Cancun, Mexico, 2022 [1].
